title: 31.4 Solving Modular Linear Equations
content:
Section 31.4

Solving Modular Linear Equations

Summary

Finding solutions to ax ≡ b (mod n).

Key Points

  • ax ≡ b (mod n) has solution iff gcd(a,n) | b
  • If solvable, exactly d = gcd(a,n) solutions
  • Use extended Euclid to find x₀ = x'(b/d) mod n
  • All solutions: x₀, x₀ + n/d, x₀ + 2n/d, ...
  • Time: O(log n) using extended Euclid

Example

14x ≡ 30 (mod 100). gcd(14,100) = 2, 2|30 ✓. Two solutions: x = 45, 95.

Why It Matters

Fundamental for cryptography and number-theoretic algorithms.
